result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrice A Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligently Abuse Patients-No Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.295(3)(a)3.
  • Negligently Abuse Patients-No Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.295(3)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with the victims and businesses/agencies listed in the criminal complaint or amended information. Not to be employed by any group home or anywhere thera are at risk individuals (to be determined by agent). Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Patrice A Davis in court with Atorney Kristen N Nelson.  Debra L Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest to Counts #1 & 2 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations. Attorney Davis makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS       *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #2**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims and businesses/agencies listed in criminal complaint/amended information
____Not to be employed by any group home or anywhere there are at risk individuals (to be determined by agent) 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 DAYS,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED -  to be used at agent's discretion) 

  
COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS       *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #1*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims and businesses/agencies listed in criminal complaint/amended information
____Not to be employed by any group home or anywhere there are at risk individuals (to be determined by agent) 

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 DAYS,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED -  to be used at agent's discretion)

Defendant Patrice A Davis in court with Attorney Kristen N Nelson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Brendon Reyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelson requests a 30 day adjournment.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Patrice A Davis in court with attorney Kristen N Nelson.  Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any of the businesses listed in the complaint or the patience or any victims listed in the complaint. Not to be employed as a care giver for persons at risk.

Defendant Patrice A Davis in court with attorney .   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested    PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:15 am.
